snippet.textDisplay: It looks like Youtube now gives the viewer the option to auto translate to their language of their choice. If the viewer is watching the video and clicks "settings", "subtitles", "auto generate" then they can select their language of choice. Is this correct or is there a specific reason the creator has to choose languages in the creator dashboard?    @@WorldofWayneUK

Hi ,
When adding languages .. there are English (united states), English (united kingdom), and English canada and india .... my question is should I add them all or is it enough to only choose one ? Does choosing English (united states )for example mean that YouTube will only recommend my video in the united states?
snippet.textOriginal:
Hi ,
When adding languages .. there are English (united states), English (united kingdom), and English canada and india .... my question is should I add them all or is it enough to only choose one ? Does choosing English (united states )for example mean that YouTube will only recommend my video in the united states?

snippet.textDisplay: It doesn't matter. It only effects spellings for subtitle like color and colour or defence and defense

snippet.textDisplay: Yep. All you need to do now is download your Englsih subtitles and then reupload them. You can edit them before publishing. This will flag your video with a closed caption icon and will automatically tra slate to any peeps watching in a different language. You no longer need to add individual countries.
snippet.textOriginal: Yep. All you need to do now is download your Englsih subtitles and then reupload them. You can edit them before publishing. snippet.textDisplay: You can also add the title and description.  I use Google Translate and put them in.
snippet.textOriginal: You can also add the title and description.  I use Google Translate and put them in.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm not sure this is a useful thing to do anymore.

As long as you have subtitles in your native language that you are happy with, in terms of grammar, structure, and accuracy... then any viewer can select the CC button and settings and auto translate into any of the languages supported by google translate.

The only reason you would want to subtitle specifically is if you maybe had a technical sort of content with nuanced language differences, or wanted someone to change the grammar to reflect how foreign languages are... they don't all really directly translate from say.. English. There are rules around language that don't translate well by an auto translation service.

Anyhow, to me this all seems like work for a content creator that is no longer necessary.
snippet.textOriginal:
I'm not sure this is a useful thing to do anymore. 

As long as you have subtitles in your native language that you are happy with, in terms of grammar, structure, and accuracy... then any viewer can select the CC button and settings and auto translate into any of the languages supported by google translate.

The only reason you would want to subtitle specifically is if you maybe had a technical sort of content with nuanced language differences, or wanted someone to change the grammar to reflect how foreign languages are... they don't all really directly translate from say.. English. There are rules around language that don't translate well by an auto translation service.

Anyhow, to me this all seems like work for a content creator that is no longer necessary.

snippet.textDisplay:
@@WorldofWayneUK good point, didn't consider that. I guess converting to 1 more language would do.

Now I am thinking.

If your viewer is say using another language, let's say German... and you HAVE subtitled specifically in german including the title and description, if your video's come up in youtube search by the foreign language they search by.

The subtitle option to watch the video is no doubt separate.

Any thoughts ? Autotranslate to view a video wouldn't help someone find your video in foreign langage if they are searching youtube in foreign languages.
snippet.textOriginal:
@@WorldofWayneUK good point, didn't consider that. I guess converting to 1 more language would do.

Now I am thinking.

If your viewer is say using another language, let's say German... and you HAVE subtitled specifically in german including the title and description, if your video's come up in youtube search by the foreign language they search by.

The subtitle option to watch the video is no  doubt separate.

Any thoughts ?  Autotranslate to view a video wouldn't help someone find your video in foreign langage if they are searching youtube in foreign languages.

snippet.textDisplay: This is not necessary to do any longer. As long as you have your CC in your native language edited how you like it, people can select CC, settings and auto translate into any language supported by google translate. Try it yourself, works great.
